newsitem.title: FINLAND: Finnish shares edge up as U.S. rate fears ease.
newsitem.headline: Finnish shares edge up as U.S. rate fears ease.

text.p: Shares ended modest Wednesday trade higher as U.S. rate jitters eased, and early gains in technology sector on Wall Street lifted Nokia, brokers said.
The HEX index rose 0.85 percent to 2,147.36 with volume a light 252 million markka, about one-third of it in Nokia which ended up 3.00 markka at 199.00.
The market was expected to continue recovering on Thursday after a soft start to the week, they said.
"The tone is slightly better now as U.S. rate fears eased," one broker said.
Metal stocks gained, probably because investors continued to underweight forestries after Metsa-Serla's profit-warning on Tuesday, brokers said.
Metsa-Serla's B share closed fair trade 0.20 markka down at 30.80. UPM-Kymmene ended active trade flat at 96.00 markka.
Cranes maker Konecranes lost 2.10 markka at 123.00 in moderate trade ahead of its January-August results due on Thursday at 1000/0700 GMT.

Beverages group Hartwall also ended lower at 123.00 markka, down 1.00, in lively trade ahead of eight-month data due on Thursday at about 1600/1300 GMT. Earlier in the session it hit a calendar-year high of 127.00.
